translation.en: SAYURI: A story like mine should never be told.
For my world is as forbidden as it is fragile.
translation.ko: 부서지기 쉬운 만큼 쉽게 허락되지 않는 세계

translation.en: Without its mysteries, it cannot survive.
translation.ko: 그 신비감이 사라지면 그 세계는 무너지고 만다

translation.en: I certainly wasn't born to the life of a geisha.
Like so much in my strange life... ...I was carried there by the current.
translation.ko: 그저 알 수 없는 운명이 날 그 세계로 이끌었다

translation.en: The first time I knew my mother was sick...
translation.ko: 엄마가 병으로 몸져누운 걸 처음 알게 된 날

translation.en: ...was when my father threw the fish back into the sea.
That night we went hungry. "To understand emptiness," he told us.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 우린 굶주리며, 아버지가 말한 배고픔이 뭔지 깨달았다

translation.en: Mother always said my sister Satsu was like wood.
translation.ko: 엄마는 늘 사츠 언니가 흙에 뿌리를 내리는

translation.en: As rooted to the earth as a sakura tree.
But she told me I was like water.
Water can carve its way, even through stone.
And when trapped, water makes a new path.
BEKKU: Stop here.
These are the girls from Tanaka? Sisters, yes, from Yoroido.
translation.ko: - 다나카가 보낸 애들인가? - 요로이도 어촌에서 온 자매예요

translation.en: This one, maybe. The other one, no.
-No, no, Chiyo! Chiyo! Chiyo! -Satsu! Satsu!
SATSU: Chiyo! CHIYO: Satsu!
Show your respect for Mother. You must not speak. I will answer for you.
translation.ko: 대모님 앞에선 예의를 갖춰 내가 답할 테니 넌 입 다물고 있어

translation.en: AUNTIE: Kneel. And head down. Never look her in the face.
-How old are you? -She is Year of the Rooster.
Only 9.
Where is my sister?
Let me see those eyes.
Look at me.
Too much water.
But, Okasan, a little water is good to guard against fire.
You won't have to worry about the okiya burning...
...losing all your kimono.
These country girls. Too late to send her back now.
Go.
Pumpkin. Keep her quiet. Mother is downstairs.
translation.ko: 펌킨, 얘가 떠들지 못하게 해 대모님이 밑에 계신다

translation.en: CHIYO: Let me go!
Let me go! Let me go! Let me go! -Stop that. -Let me go!
Mother will hear you. She's got a bamboo stick.
translation.ko: - 내보내 줘! - 대모가 듣는다고! - 대모한테 회초리로 맞는다고 - 언니한테 갈래!

translation.en: I want my sister! Satsu!
translation.ko: - 대모한테 회초리로 맞는다고 - 언니한테 갈래! 사츠!

translation.en: I cried too at first.
You know, it is easier if you just forget everything... ...that happened before you came to the okiya.
translation.ko: 기왕 '오키야'에 왔으니 집 생각은 빨리 잊는 게 좋아

translation.en: If you impress Mother and do exactly as she says...
translation.ko: 대모 말 잘 듣고 예쁘게 보이면

translation.en: ...she will send you to school to be a geisha.
A what? A geisha. Like Hatsumomo.
You will get to drink sake and sleep until noon.
Where is my sister?
Probably in another okiya in the hanamachi.
translation.ko: 이곳 하나마치 지역 어딘가에 있는 '오키야'에 있겠지

translation.en: Your family sold you to this house.
You live here now.
Outside, you wear these. Inside, these.
translation.ko: 나갈 땐 이거 안에선 이걸 신어

translation.en: We don't display our naked feet like monkeys.
It's not flesh we're selling here. This is a geisha house.
translation.ko: 여긴 몸을 파는 곳이 아니라 게이샤의 집, '오키야'다

translation.en: Remember to always honor this okiya. You listen, you learn.
translation.ko: 항상 여기 있게 된 걸 영광으로 알고, 잘 듣고 배워

translation.en: Now get to work.
Be quiet. Hatsumomo is sleeping.
Pumpkin, when can I go outside?
translation.ko: 펌킨, 밖엔 언제 나갈 수 있지?

translation.en: Outside the okiya? You can't. It's not allowed.
translation.ko: '오키야' 밖으로? 넌 못 나가 나가면 죽어

translation.en: How will I find Satsu?
You can't just walk up to every house in the hanamachi.
Do you know how many there are?
Look.
HATSUMOMO: Tighter!
PUMPKIN: Chiyo. Chiyo-chan.
Come. Two nights ago, Hatsumomo had to stay at the teahouse until dawn.
That's what she told Mother. But she was really here with a man the whole--
translation.ko: 밤새 다원에 있었다지만 사실은 남자랑 밤새...

translation.en: Why can't you be quiet?
So this is the new arrival.
A pity she still stinks of fish.
Stay out of my room. Your fingers smell.
translation.ko: 내 방엔 얼씬도 마 냄새 밴단 말이야

translation.en: I can't have you touching my things.
AUNTIE: Only reason Mother tolerates Hatsumomo... ...is because she brings in good money.
translation.ko: 대모님이 하츠모모를 봐주는 건 돈은 잘 벌어오거든

translation.en: Never forget.
It is Hatsumomo who pays for your supper... ...the clothes on your back.
translation.ko: 너나 나나 걔가 벌어온 돈으로 먹고 입는 거야

translation.en: By the time she was 20...
...she had already earned back her purchase price.
translation.ko: 자기 몸값을 갚고도 남을 만큼 벌었지

translation.en: Unheard of.
She has been the talk of the hanamachi ever since.
These are all hers?
Certainly not. They belong to the okiya.
A kimono like this, made of Tatsumura silk...
...it would take a lifetime to earn.
translation.ko: 평생 벌어도 살까 말까 한 거야

translation.en: A geisha needs an elegant wardrobe... ...just like an artist needs ink.
translation.ko: 게이샤의 우아한 의상은 화가의 물감과 같지

translation.en: If she's not properly dressed, then she is not a true geisha.
translation.ko: 제대로 갖춰 입지 않으면 게이샤라고 할 수 없어

translation.en: Nobody told me what a geisha is. You will find out soon enough.
translation.ko: - 전 게이샤가 뭔지도 몰랐어요 - 너도 곧 알게 돼

translation.en: I have news for you, child.
Mother has determined it is off to school with you.
You are to become geisha.
MOTHER: Chiyo! Pumpkin!
Quick, quick! Don't be late!
You will be late. Go. Go.
PUMPKIN: This way!
CHIYO: Pumpkin! Pumpkin!
Pumpkin! I'm going to run. I'm going to find Satsu.
translation.ko: 펌킨 나 도망칠래! 사츠 언니를 찾을 거야!

translation.en: No, Chiyo-chan, don't!
You will ruin your own chances. And mine too.
Please, stay with me.
Squid. Come on!
PUMPKIN: Look for your sister's name later.
[IN ENGLISH] You are late!
MOTHER: Chiyo! Where is Granny's food?
GRANNY: Where have you been?
-It's freezing cold! -Hai.
Close the window!
ANNOUNCER [OVER RADIO]: --with millions of people unemployed...
translation.ko: 빨리 독일은 현재 아사 직전에 있는 수백만 실업자들이...

translation.en: ...on the brink of starvation.
translation.ko: 독일은 현재 아사 직전에 있는 수백만 실업자들이...

translation.en: Another cause of Germany's suffering is the constant struggle... ...to pay the heavy burden of war reparations it's still....
translation.ko: ...끊임없이 분투 중이며 전후의 막대한 전쟁 배상금이...

translation.en: MOTHER: Chiyo! Chiyo, come quickly!
Hatsumomo is at the bathhouse. Tidy up.
translation.ko: 하츠모모는 지금 욕탕에 있으니까 오기 전에 청소해 놔

translation.en: -But she told me to stay out-- -Hatsumomo does not run this okiya.
translation.ko: - 하지만 방엔 얼씬도 말라고... - '오키야' 주인은 나야

translation.en: ANNOUNCER [OVER RADIO]: The Japanese emperor has agreed... ...to send army instructors to Manchuria.
HATSUMOMO: Why, look who's in my room.
Did you touch this?
I can just hear the General now.
"Why, Hatsumomo, you used to smell of jasmine.
What's this new perfume? Blowfish?"
I told you never to touch my things. Can't you understand why?
translation.ko: 내가 왜 내 물건 만지지 말라고 했는지 이제 알겠니?

translation.en: Because your General will say, "Hatsumomo, you stink."
At least you don't smell as bad as your sister.
You know, she was here. She came by looking for you.
translation.ko: 네 언니가 일전에 - 널 찾으러 여기 왔었어 - 네?

translation.en: What?
Was I wrong to ask her to leave? Please, tell me where she is.
translation.ko: - 내가 쫓아버렸는데 잘못한 거니? - 언니 있는 곳을 알려주세요

translation.en: Only if you swear yourself to me first.
Yes? Huh?
Now, get out.
Shh! Hatsumomo. You'll wake the entire house.
Your big sister is thirsty. So am I. Go get us some beer.
translation.ko: 네 큰언니랑 내가 목이 마른다, 맥주 좀 가져와

translation.en: I'm not in the mood for beer.
I know what you're in the mood for, and his name is Koichi.
translation.ko: 네 갈증이 뭔지 알지 코이치란 사내지?

translation.en: What did you say, Korin? Huh?
I'm sorry. I forgot.
You're just jealous someone cares for me.
translation.ko: 누가 날 좋아한다니 샘나서 그런 거지?

translation.en: Guess who this belongs to.
A geisha as desired as she is... ...ought to keep a close eye on her clothes.
translation.ko: 무릇 최고의 게이샤라면 옷 관리도 철저히 해야지

translation.en: -It's Mameha's? HATSUMOMO: Yes.
KORIN: How did you get it? HATSUMOMO: Bribed her maid.
-There. -I can't.
Give it to her.
-Little Chiyo, come. Come. -Chiyo.
translation.ko: - 치요, 이리 와 - 치요, 이리 와

translation.en: HATSUMOMO: Now, then, little Chiyo, it's time to practice your calligraphy.
There.
Remember, you swore yourself to me. Yes.
Don't let anybody see you.
Go, go!
This will teach the great Mameha.
translation.ko: 마메하 대모가 까무러치는 꼴을 보게 되겠군

translation.en: Thieving rat!
That kimono was worth more than you!
Careful! You will hurt yourself more than her!
translation.ko: - 그 기모노가 얼마짜린데! - 진정해요 그러다 대모님이 다치겠어요!

translation.en: Let me.
AUNTIE: Kneel!
What have you done to Hatsumomo?
I haven't done anything. I promise you.
Her little trick with that kimono will cost you.
translation.ko: 하츠모모 꼬임에 넘어간 대가를 톡톡히 치르게 될 거야

translation.en: Whatever you have done to anger her, you'd be wise to stop now.
Lie facedown!
I will beat you hard... ...so Mother does not beat you harder.
translation.ko: 세게 때릴 거다 대모의 매질보다는 좀 나을 거야

translation.en: I told you not to let anybody see you.
I have kept my promise. So tell me, where is she?
translation.ko: 시키는 대로 했으니까 언니 있는 데를 말해줘요!

translation.en: She's in the next hanamachi in the house called Tatsuyo.
translation.ko: 하나마치 옆 동네에 있는 타츠요라는 집에 있어

translation.en: In the pleasure district.
Trust me, little Chiyo, you will find her.
translation.ko: 한번 가봐 언니를 찾을 수 있을 거야

translation.en: Tatsuyo?
CHIYO: Satsu! Satsu! Satsu!
Satsu from Yoroido! Satsu! Satsu!
No! Satsu! No! Satsu! Satsu!
Sat--
Satsu! Satsu!
Chiyo-chan!
What took you so long? -But, Satsu, I tried! -Shh!
I went to your okiya weeks ago. They laughed and turned me away.
translation.ko: 몇 주 전에 너한테 갔다가 문 앞에서 조롱당하고 쫓겨났어!

translation.en: Please, I did not know! I've missed you so much!
Let's leave. Tonight.
translation.ko: - 오늘 밤에 당장 도망치자 - 돈 없인 안 돼, 치요

translation.en: But we need money, Chiyo. I know I can steal some first thing tomorrow.
translation.ko: - 오늘 밤에 당장 도망치자 - 돈 없인 안 돼, 치요 내일 내가 훔쳐볼게

translation.en: -No, please! Tonight! -No, tomorrow!
translation.ko: - 안 돼, 오늘 밤에 가! - 말 들어, 내일 가자

translation.en: Meet me at the Sasame Bridge as soon as it's dark.
translation.ko: 해 질 녘에 사사미 다리에서 만나자

translation.en: Now I have to go. Quickly, before someone catches us.
translation.ko: 난 가봐야 돼 누가 보기 전에 빨리 가

translation.en: What if I cannot get away?
Be there, Chiyo. It's our one chance. Once I've left, I can't go back.
translation.ko: 꼭 나와, 치요, 유일한 기회야 여길 나가면, 다시 돌아올 수 없어

translation.en: I've waited as long as I can. Now go!
translation.ko: 더 이상은 못 기다려 어서 가봐!

translation.en: What is she doing here? She's seen us.
Stupid girl. Why have you come back?
Your perfect chance to escape!
Get in!
-Koichi, please. -Look at us.
Sneaking around like criminals.
-Koichi, don't-- -It's degrading.
MOTHER: What's going on?
Koichi.
MOTHER: Who's there?
Go! Now! Go!
MOTHER: Show your face.
Look, Okasan! I caught her stealing!
She was running away with her sister, the whore!
You little thief!
CHIYO: No! She is lying!
-After all we have done for her! -I saw her with a man! Right there!
translation.ko: - 아니에요, 거짓말이에요! - 이 배은망덕한 계집년 언니가 남자랑 저기 있었어요! 이름은 코이치고요

translation.en: His name is Koichi!
translation.ko: 언니가 남자랑 저기 있었어요! 이름은 코이치고요

translation.en: Shut up! We should kick her out!
Take her arms.
You are never to see him again. Huh?
What do you think? A geisha is free to love? Never.
translation.ko: 가당찮게 게이샤가 연애를 해? 꿈 깨

translation.en: Bolt the gate! No one is leaving this okiya.
translation.ko: 문 걸어! 아무도 이 집에서 못 나갈 줄 알아

translation.en: MOTHER: Dr. Moro is very expensive.
translation.ko: 저 모로 의사는 치료비가 장난이 아니야

translation.en: You seem to be racking up quite a debt.
translation.ko: 내게 진 빚이 엄청 많은 것 같구나

translation.en: Kimono destroyed... ...geisha school...
...rice and pickles, train ticket, Mr. Bekku.
All this on top of the money I paid Mr. Tanaka.
translation.ko: 다나카 씨에게 준 몸값 말고도 말이야

translation.en: And for what?
translation.ko: 너 같은 걸 왜 샀나 모르겠다

translation.en: And now I hear that your sister has run away.
She didn't wait for you. And now she can never come back.
translation.ko: 널 기다리지도 않고 다신 안 돌아올걸

translation.en: You must forget you ever had a sister. Huh?
We are your only family now.
"Dear Satsu and little Chiyo: As one who was once an orphan child myself...
...this humble person is sorry to inform you...
translation.ko: '이렇게 슬픈 소식을 전하게 돼 정말 마음이 아프구나'

translation.en: ...that six weeks after you left for your new life in Miyako...
...the suffering of your honored mother came to its end.
translation.ko: '병상에 있던 너희 어머니가 결국 세상을 뜨셨단다'

translation.en: And only a few weeks afterward...
...your honored father departed this world as well.
translation.ko: '너희 아버지도 몇 주 후 어머니를 따라가셨단다'

translation.en: This humble person feels confident both your honored parents...
...have found their places in paradise. But happily...."
SAYURI: At the temple... ...there is a poem called "Loss" carved into the stone.
translation.ko: 어떤 절에 '상실'이란 시가 새겨진 돌이 있었는데

translation.en: It has three words.
translation.ko: 거기엔 세 개의 시구가 적혀 있었는데

translation.en: But the poet has scratched them out.
translation.ko: 어느 날 시인이 그 시구를 긁어내 버렸다

translation.en: You cannot read "Loss." Only feel it.
My father and mother had left this life.
My sister, I never heard of again.
I had dishonored the okiya, so Mother had other plans for me.
translation.ko: 난 그날 밤 몰래 도망치려 한 죄로

translation.en: I would pay back my debt... ...year after year after year.
Not as a geisha. As her slave.
CHAIRMAN: It is too pretty a day to be so unhappy.
translation.ko: 이렇게 화창한 날 왜 울고 있는 거니?

translation.en: Did you fall down?
Why so shy?
Nothing to be ashamed of. We all stumble from time to time.
translation.ko: 창피할 거 없어 넘어질 수도 있지

translation.en: You see that enchanting lady in green?
translation.ko: 저 푸른 옷을 입은 예쁜 아가씨 보이지?

translation.en: Once, when she was just a maiko, she fell clean off her wooden shoes.
translation.ko: 전에 게이샤 견습생일 때 나막신 때문에 수도 없이 넘어졌어

translation.en: It's true, I did.
And now look at her. So elegant.
Mr. Chairman, shouldn't we hurry? We will miss the beginning.
We see the Spring Dances every year. We can spare a moment.
translation.ko: '스프링 댄스'는 매년 보는 건데 좀 놓치면 어때

translation.en: What's your name?
Don't be afraid to look at me.
Do you like sweet plum or cherry?
You mean, to eat?
I like sweet plum myself. Come.
translation.ko: 난 자두 맛이 좋더라 이리 와

translation.en: None of us find as much kindness in this life as we should.
Hi. Both kinds, please.
translation.ko: 저기요, 두 가지 맛 다 주세요

translation.en: My children wait for these every spring.
translation.ko: 아저씨 아이들도 매년 봄이 되면 이걸 무척 좋아한단다

translation.en: Now I'm a geisha too.
And so you are.
How did you come by such surprising eyes?
My mother gave them to me.
Generous of her, wasn't it?
As you have been to me.
Smile for me, won't you?
There, now. That is your gift to me.
This will buy your supper. Now, promise me one thing:
translation.ko: 이걸로 저녁도 사 먹고 아저씨랑 약속하자

translation.en: Next time you take a tumble, no frowns.
That's better.
SAYURI: In that moment... ...I changed from a girl facing nothing but emptiness...
translation.ko: 그 순간 희망도 없이 살아가던 슬픈 소녀는

translation.en: ...to someone with purpose.
I saw that to be a geisha...
...could be a stepping stone to something else: A place in his world.
translation.ko: 그에게 좀 더 가까이 다가갈 수 있는 길이 있을 것만 같았다

translation.en: The money the Chairman had given me...
...could have bought fish and rice for a month.
translation.ko: 한 달은 배불리 먹을 수 있는 그 돈을

translation.en: But I gave it back in prayer... ...keeping only his handkerchief.
translation.ko: 난 전부 신께 바치고 그의 손수건만 간직했다

translation.en: I asked one day to become a geisha.
translation.ko: 꼭 게이샤가 되게 해달라고 진심으로 빌었다

translation.en: And then, somehow, to meet him again.
translation.ko: 그래서 그를 다시 만날 수 있게 해달라고

translation.en: ANNOUNCER [OVER RADIO]: The Imperial War Ministry announces news:
A great victory for our friend Adolf Hitler.
Today, Hitler demanded self-determination...
...for Germans living in Austria.
Hitler's quest for lebensraum, "living space"....
PUMPKIN: Chiyo-chan, I can't find my comb! Did you find it yet?
translation.ko: 치요, 내 장식 빗! 아직 못 찾았어?

translation.en: AUNTIE: Pumpkin, it's time to go.
CHIYO: I found it. PUMPKIN: Arigato, Chiyo.
translation.ko: - 펌킨, 갈 시간이야 - 찾았어 고마워, 치요

translation.en: Oh, I couldn't sleep last night, I was so worried about my stupid hair.
translation.ko: 머리 망가질까 봐 밤에 한숨도 못 잤어

translation.en: Am I lopsided? You look beautiful.
translation.ko: - 한쪽으로 치우친 거 아니니? - 너무 예뻐

translation.en: With your hair like that... ...you look more like a pumpkin than ever.
translation.ko: 이쁘긴 쥐뿔 늙은 호박이 따로 없구나

translation.en: Don't poke your neck forward like a tortoise.
She's not ready? We will be late.
Poor Pumpkin. Her debut, and everyone will be staring at you.
translation.ko: 펌킨이 안됐네요, 걔 데뷔 날인데 당신이 더 돋보이겠어요

translation.en: -Hurry up, huh? -This time...
translation.ko: 빨리 와 이번엔 연주 전에 꼭 샤미센을 조율해

translation.en: ...tune your shamisen before you play.
translation.ko: 이번엔 연주 전에 꼭 샤미센을 조율해

translation.en: When you make a fool of yourself, your big sister gets the blame.
translation.ko: 바보 같은 짓 해서 큰언니 낯 붉히게 하지 말고

translation.en: Stop crying, your face will run.
HATSUMOMO: Pumpkin! PUMPKIN: Hai.
CHIYO: Pumpkin!
SAYURI: The winter I turned 15, I saw the Chairman again.
translation.ko: 15세가 되던 해 겨울 그를 다시 만났다

translation.en: But that wasn't the only surprise fate brought me that season.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 해에 또 다른 특별한 운명이

translation.en: Along with the snow came a most unexpected visitor.
translation.ko: 눈 내리던 어느 날 예기치 못한 손님과 함께 찾아왔다

translation.en: Why is she here?
Chiyo! Chiyo! Open the gate!
MAMEHA: Now that your beloved Granny is gone... ...you'll have no need for a maid.
translation.ko: 이제 아끼던 할머니도 가셨으니 하녀는 필요 없겠군요

translation.en: MOTHER: I would never question the great Mameha...
translation.ko: 마메하 대모라면 믿을 수 있죠 하나마치에 있는 누구라도 뽑을 수 있잖아요

translation.en: ...but you could choose anyone in the hanamachi.
translation.ko: 하나마치에 있는 누구라도 뽑을 수 있잖아요

translation.en: You flatter me, truly.
I'd give you my Pumpkin if she were not already tied to Hatsumomo.
Please. I would never dream of asking.
Besides, I could always sell Chiyo to Mrs. Tatsuyo.
translation.ko: 치요란 애가 있긴 한데, 걔는 언제라도 홍등가에 팔 수 있죠

translation.en: MAMEHA: With your eye for beauty and nose for talent...
...surely you can see what a terrible waste that would be.
translation.ko: 그게 얼마나 큰 손해인지 정도는 알고도 남으시리라 생각해요

translation.en: If you were not the kindhearted geisha I know you to be...
...then I might think you were scheming against Hatsumomo.
translation.ko: 하츠모모를 상대로 당신이 꼼수를 쓰는 거라 의심했을 겁니다

translation.en: Then I'm grateful, Mrs. Nitta, that you don't have a suspicious mind.
translation.ko: 니타 부인께서 저를 잘 아는 분이라 다행이에요

translation.en: Perhaps you can pique my interest with...
MAMEHA: Yes?
...your offer.
I will cover Chiyo's schooling, all her expenses... ...till after her debut.
translation.ko: 치요가 게이샤로 데뷔할 때까지 학비와 모든 비용을 대겠어요

translation.en: Now I am confident you are teasing.
I could not be more sincere.
If Chiyo hasn't repaid her debt within six months after her debut--
translation.ko: 데뷔 후 6개월 내에 여기 빚을 못 갚는다면...

translation.en: Impossible! Too little time. --then I will pay you twice over.
translation.ko: - 그건 불가능해요, 시간이 짧아요 - 그럼 제가 두 배로 갚죠

translation.en: What?
No geisha could ever....
I am certain you will not object to one trivial condition.
Yes?
If Chiyo erases her debt in the time allowed...
...you will have no part in her future earnings.
It's too good to be true. Mameha is up to something.
translation.ko: 믿기지가 않아 무슨 꿍꿍이가 있는 게 분명해

translation.en: She isn't in it for the money. That much is for certain.
Rumor has it, ever since the prime minister bought her mizuage...
-...she's been rich. -Mizuage?
MOTHER: That so? Absurd to think she noticed Chiyo.
translation.ko: 그래? - 치요를 언제 봤다고 저럴까? - 기모노 때문이에요

translation.en: It's that kimono.
translation.ko: - 치요를 언제 봤다고 저럴까? - 기모노 때문이에요

translation.en: She remembers how you destroyed it.
translation.ko: 네가 그 기모노에 낙서한 걸 기억하는 거야

translation.en: -Now she wants to get even. MOTHER: An odd picture, isn't it?
Hatsumomo sweeping into teahouse after teahouse with our little Pumpkin.
translation.ko: 하츠모모가 펌킨이랑 다원을 다 손에 쥐고 있는데

translation.en: And Mameha with our maid.
I'm so far behind. I will never catch up to you.
translation.ko: 난 한참 멀었는데 너처럼 잘하지 못할 거야

translation.en: Don't worry, Chiyo-chan. I will help you.
Pumpkin!
You are never to speak to her again. Now you are rivals.
translation.ko: 다시는 얘랑 말도 하지 마! 너희는 이제 라이벌이야

translation.en: CHIYO: Pumpkin.
Pumpkin.
SAYURI: This is how it was, this tiny world of women.
translation.ko: 이런 게 이 폐쇄된 세계의 생리였다

translation.en: Friend turned against friend.
And now the two greatest geisha in Miyako at war over me.
translation.ko: 미야코 최고의 게이샤 두 명은 나 때문에 숙적이 됐다

translation.en: Hatsumomo at my back.
Mameha calling, offering me the chance...
translation.ko: 하츠모모와 달리 마메하 언니는 내게 전에 다리에서 만났던

translation.en: ...to become one of those elegant women I'd seen on the bridge...
translation.ko: 마메하 언니는 내게 전에 다리에서 만났던 그런 우아한 여인이 될 수 있는 기회를 주었다

translation.en: ...floating in a silk kimono, the Chairman at my side.
translation.ko: 나도 하늘거리는 비단 기모노를 입고 회장님 곁에 있던 그 여인이 되는 거다

translation.en: Chiyo is my new protégée.
As lovely as her big sister. And with eyes the color of rain.
translation.ko: 당신만큼이나 아름답군 거기에 물기 어린 눈까지

translation.en: MAMEHA: The Baron is a very special man to me. My danna.
translation.ko: 남작은 내게 아주 특별한 분이시다 나의 후견인이야

translation.en: Someday, if you are fortunate, you will have a patron too.
Don't kneel. You are not a servant girl anymore.
translation.ko: 무릎 꿇지 마 넌 이제 하녀가 아니야

translation.en: Step into the light.
I see water in you.
Does that displease you? MAMEHA: Water is powerful.
It can wash away earth, put out fire and even destroy iron.
translation.ko: 흙을 쓸어내고 불을 끄고 철을 녹슬게 해

translation.en: But you have not drawn on those strengths, have you?
translation.ko: 하지만 그 힘을 써보지는 않은 모양이구나

translation.en: About your kimono....
You may apologize if you wish.
Why, that is a perfect bow... ...for a pig farmer.
translation.ko: 절이 그게 뭐니? 기본이 안 됐어

translation.en: Don't drop your head. Fingertips together. Elbows in. No weight on the hands.
translation.ko: 머리 들고 손끝을 모아 팔은 펴고 손에 힘 싣지 마

translation.en: Yes.
As for the kimono, I'm no fool, Chiyo. Hatsumomo cannot tolerate competition.
translation.ko: 치요, 진짜 범인은 나도 알아 하츠모모는 지는 걸 못 견디지

translation.en: She is jealous of you?
Not me, I'm afraid.
Someone closer to home.
Rise.
Not like a horse.
Slide your foot forward.
translation.ko: 앞으로 슬쩍 한 발 디디면서 일어나

translation.en: That's it. Now walk. You are a magnificent geisha.
translation.ko: 그렇지, 이제 너는 아주 훌륭한 게이샤라고 생각하며 걸어봐

translation.en: Tell me, Chiyo, does Mrs. Nitta ever speak of the future?
translation.ko: 치요, 네 미래에 대해 대모가 아무 말 없던?

translation.en: CHIYO: Not to me.
Well, someday soon, she will have to name an heir.
One of her own geisha to succeed her.
Strange, isn't it, she has not adopted Hatsumomo.
That would be like releasing the tiger from its cage.
You have a gift for expression.
And if Mrs. Nitta adopts Pumpkin...
...that is hardly a threat.
But a young girl with eyes like rain....
But Mrs. Nitta would never choose me. On the contrary, that is our goal.
translation.ko: - 대모님이 절 선택할 리 없어요 - 하지만 널 선택하게 만들어야 해

translation.en: -It is? -Of course.
If you do not inherit the okiya, then we will all be at the tiger's mercy.
translation.ko: 네가 '오키야'를 차지하지 않으면 모두 호랑이 밥이 될 거야

translation.en: Water's always in such a hurry.
Perhaps it is just as well.
We have no time to lose.
MAMEHA: We must transform you.
And what takes years, you must learn in months.
translation.ko: 넌 몇 달 안에 다 배워야만 해

translation.en: Say I'm entertaining the Baron.
Like so many clients, he's trapped in an arranged marriage.
So in the teahouse, when he's seeking my company instead...
...I reward him like this: With a glimpse of my wrist.
translation.ko: 그럴 땐 이렇게 살짝 손목을 보여줘

translation.en: Seeing this demure little trace of naked skin....
Well, it gives him pleasure.
Or when you're sitting down...
...for the briefest moment, press your leg against his.
translation.ko: 곁에 앉을 땐 한순간 다리가 살짝 닿게 앉아

translation.en: Always by accident, of course.
CHIYO: Mameha, when does a geisha choose her danna?
translation.ko: 마메하 대모님, 언제 후견인을 선택하게 되나요?

translation.en: MAMEHA: I'm afraid it's the other way around.
Focus on your studies, Chiyo. Music, the art of conversation.
translation.ko: 우선 공부나 끝내 기악과 화술에 능해야

translation.en: That's the surest way to attract a danna. On your feet, not off them.
translation.ko: 좋은 후견인을 만날 수 있어 걸음걸이도 중요해

translation.en: MAMEHA: Remember, Chiyo, geisha are not courtesans.
translation.ko: 잊지 마 게이샤는 기녀가 아니야 또한 아내도 아니지

translation.en: And we are not wives.
translation.ko: 게이샤는 기녀가 아니야 또한 아내도 아니지

translation.en: We sell our skills, not our bodies.
translation.ko: 우린 예능을 팔 뿐 몸은 팔지 않아

translation.en: We create another secret world. A place only of beauty.
translation.ko: 우리는 은밀한 세계를 만들지 거긴 오직 아름다움만 존재해

translation.en: The very word "geisha" means "artist."
And to be a geisha is to be judged as a moving work of art.
translation.ko: 또한 그 자체로 살아있는 예술 작품이지

translation.en: MAMEHA: Agony and beauty, for us, live side by side.
Your feet will suffer, your fingers will bleed.
translation.ko: 발은 아프고 손톱엔 피가 날 거야

translation.en: Even sitting and sleeping will be painful.
You cannot call yourself a true geisha...
...until you can stop a man in his tracks with a single look.
translation.ko: 한 번의 눈길로 남자를 사로잡아야 해

translation.en: No one can do that. Choose someone for me.
The gray hat.
CHIYO: Choose someone for me, Onei-san.
The boy on the bike, with one look.
translation.ko: 자전거를 타고 오는 청년 딱 한 번이야

translation.en: You are ready.
MOTHER: Hurry up! You are not making money standing there gawking at yourself.
translation.ko: 서둘러! 그렇게 얼빠진 채 보고 서 있다고 돈이 나온다니?

translation.en: For luck!
MAMEHA: This binds us together forever as sisters.
Today you leave your childhood and cast away your name.
From this day forward, you will be known as:
"Sayuri."
SAYURI: When Mameha granted me my new name...
translation.ko: 마메하 언니가 새 이름을 줬을 때

translation.en: ...I felt little Chiyo disappear behind a white mask with red lips.
translation.ko: 하얀 분과 빨간 루주 뒤로 어린 치요가 사라지는 기분이었다

translation.en: I was a maiko now. An apprentice geisha.
From that moment, I told myself:
"When I make tea, when I pour sake...
...when I dance, when I tie my obi...
...it will be for the Chairman.
Until he finds me.
Until I am his."
Ready?
Onei-san.
Thank you.
Friends...
...we have the pleasure to witness the debut of a new maiko.
translation.ko: 오늘 새로 데뷔하는 '마이코'를 보게 되어 기쁘군요

translation.en: I remember those eyes. What was her name?
Sayuri.
BARON: Determined, isn't she?
If there'd been a drop of tea in that pot, Sayuri would have gotten it out.
MAMEHA: Don't tease, Baron, it is her very first time.
What a beautiful dance, yes, Pumpkin?
Her fans are so hypnotic... ...that you never notice her feet.
translation.ko: 현란한 묘기에 팔려 서툰 춤은 보지도 못했어

translation.en: -What's her name? MAMEHA: Her name is Sayuri.
Sayuri? A name as sweet as she is.
I'm afraid these days... ...even a common chambermaid can call herself a geisha.
So it's nice to see such a sincere young maiko. Isn't it?
translation.ko: 이렇게 어리고 참한 '마이코'를 보니 좋네요, 안 그래요?

translation.en: Why, yes.
Surely you would like to thank Hatsumomo... ...for her gracious compliments.
There is so much I would like to say to Hatsumomo.
translation.ko: 하츠모모 님께 하고픈 말이 참 많아요

translation.en: Sometimes the smartest remark is silence.
What better advice to follow than your own?
MAMEHA: Sayuri.
-I was a maiko myself once. SAYURI: Of course.
But it's been such a very long...
...long, long, long time.
I shall destroy you.
MAMEHA: She can destroy you. She will spread rumors...
translation.ko: 하츠모모가 널 망칠 수도 있어 그녀는 대모가 너 대신 펌킨을 양녀로 삼게 하려고

translation.en: ...stalk you from teahouse to teahouse, then steal your clients.
translation.ko: 그녀는 대모가 너 대신 펌킨을 양녀로 삼게 하려고

translation.en: All in the hope that Mrs. Nitta adopts Pumpkin instead of you.
translation.ko: 다원마다 악소문을 퍼뜨리고 쫓아다니며 고객을 채 갈 거야

translation.en: -What can we do? -We've got to outwit her.
To find a place somewhere beyond her reach...
...where you can practice your skills without any interference.
-Your first sumo match. -What?
translation.ko: - 첫 번째로 스모를 볼 거야 - 예?

translation.en: MAMEHA: Today you will meet Iwamura Ken.
He is head of the Iwamura Electric Company in Osaka.
translation.ko: 오사카에 있는 이와무라 전기 회사의 회장이야

translation.en: My client for years.
We will entertain him and his partner, Nobu.
We may find Nobu quite a challenge. He does not like geisha.
MAMEHA: Be attentive. I will do the rest.
translation.ko: 넌 보고만 있어 나머지는 내가 알아서 할게

translation.en: Chairman Iwamura. President Nobu. This is my new younger sister, Sayuri.
translation.ko: 이와무라 회장님, 노부 사장님 저의 자매 사유리예요

translation.en: CHAIRMAN: Nobu-san.
Nobu-san.
[IN ENGLISH] Injured in Manchuria. War hero.
Sayuri, is this your first sumo match?
Nobu-san will have to educate you. I cannot tell one wrestler from the next.
That is the Chairman's diplomatic way of saying he hates sumo.
CHAIRMAN: Did you notice our contribution?
translation.ko: 우리 회사가 어떤 공헌을 했는지 눈치챘나?

translation.en: We are harnessing the power of water...
...to bring electricity to some of the smaller villages.
translation.ko: 우린 수력발전으로 몇몇 작은 마을에 전기를 공급하고 있어

translation.en: -It was in the newspapers, wasn't it? -With the Chairman's picture.
You compensate for all my shortcomings, don't you?
May I ask, how does someone harness the power of water?
You should never ask an engineer to explain a thing, because he will--
translation.ko: 밤새우고 싶지 않으면 기술자에게 질문 안 하는 게 좋을 거야

translation.en: Let the girl watch sumo.
Hatsumomo, that snake. Quick, turn your attention to Nobu.
translation.ko: 하츠모모, 저 뱀 같은 것 계속 노부 씨에게 말을 걸어

translation.en: But, Mameha-neisan--
Hatsumomo finds him repulsive. She'd never steal him away.
translation.ko: 노부 씨를 혐오스럽게 보니까 채 갈 엄두를 못 낼 거야

translation.en: Mislead her. Go.
Perhaps Nobu-san will be kind enough to explain the rules of the match.
Three things matter in life: sumo, business and war.
translation.ko: 인생에는 세 가지가 있지 스모, 사업 그리고 전쟁

translation.en: Understand one, you know them all.
translation.ko: 그중 하나를 알면 삶의 이치를 알 수 있지

translation.en: But why should a geisha care?
translation.ko: 게이샤 따위가 삶의 이치는 알아 뭐 해?

translation.en: You spend your time plucking strings and dancing.
I humbly beg to differ.
What is sumo but a dance between giants?
What is business but a dance between companies?
I'd like to know about every kind of dance.
translation.ko: 전 삶의 모든 춤을 알고 싶어요

translation.en: They are throwing salt to purify the ring.
That man is Miyagiyama, the greatest fighter in Japan.
translation.ko: 저 사람은 미야기야마인데 일본 최고의 파이터지

translation.en: SAYURI: But he's so tiny.
NOBU: Only compared to his opponent.
Miyagiyama may use hataki komi.
NOBU: Are you listening? Yes.
Hataki komi is a movement the smaller combatant uses...
...to throw the larger man off balance.
translation.ko: 덩치 큰 선수의 균형을 잃게 만드는 기술이지

translation.en: Victory does not always belong to the powerful.
Look. There. In his eyes.
I'm afraid our time has come to a close.
-Going so soon? -Not yet. I want her to see.
translation.ko: - 이렇게 빨리? - 이따 데려가, 더 보고 가게

translation.en: Now that is hataki komi! I see now why you like sumo.
translation.ko: - 저게 바로 '하타키코미'야! - 왜 스모를 좋아하는지 알겠네요

translation.en: You can never judge a man's power by his appearance alone.
translation.ko: 스모도 보이는 것만으로 판단해선 안 되겠군요

translation.en: Mameha.
You may bring her again.
SAYURI: I scoured the newspaper for the Chairman's photograph.
translation.ko: 난 신문을 뒤져 그의 사진을 찾아냈다

translation.en: Anything to preserve our moment together.
translation.ko: 그와 함께했던 시간을 간직할 만한 그 어떤 거라도

translation.en: A moment stolen...
...when I was forced to turn my attention to Nobu.
translation.ko: 노부 씨에게 관심을 쏟아야 했을 때

translation.en: In that instant, I felt the world shift.
But not my own determination.
I made a secret promise:
Along with his picture, I would lock away my heart...
translation.ko: 그의 사진과 함께 내 사랑은 그가 아닌 어떤 사람에게도 주지 않겠노라고

translation.en: ...and save it for him.
-Onei-san. MAMEHA: Come in.
Tonight we will deliver a quick blow to Hatsumomo. Hataki komi.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤에 하츠모모에게 한 방 먹일 생각이야, '하타키코미'로

translation.en: -How? -We will meet Nobu-san...
translation.ko: 어떻게요? 노부 씨와 수나시마 식당에서 저녁을 먹을 거야

translation.en: ...at the Tsunashima restaurant.
translation.ko: 노부 씨와 수나시마 식당에서 저녁을 먹을 거야

translation.en: But first, a visit to Dr. Crab.
translation.ko: - 먼저 크랩 박사에게 들러야 해 - '크랩' 박사요?

translation.en: -Dr. Crab? -It's a little nickname...
translation.ko: - 먼저 크랩 박사에게 들러야 해 - '크랩' 박사요? 수년간 불려온 별명이지

translation.en: -...he's earned over the years. -Onei-san!
MAMEHA: Hold still.
I have something in mind. A plan. Now cut your leg where I've marked it.
translation.ko: 이게 다 계획의 일부야 이제 내가 표시한 데를 찔러

translation.en: -What? -Or I will do it for you--
translation.ko: 네? - 안 하면 내가 해줄게 - 미쳤어요?

translation.en: Have you gone mad?
Do you trust me or don't you?
Well?
Go ahead, do it.
Careless with the sewing scissors, were you?
Right through your beautiful kimono. Such a pity.
MAMEHA: It won't leave a scar, will it?
Sayuri is a special girl at a very special time in her life.
DR. CRAB: Yes. With those eyes, you must be quite a commodity.
translation.ko: 그렇군, 이런 신비한 눈은 값이 상당히 나가지

translation.en: Clean cut.
Won't leave a mark, I promise.
But I had best prescribe a bit of antiseptic.
SAYURI: Your honorable sister says, "Cut your leg," you cut your leg.
She says, "Follow me," you follow her.
My life had turned into a game... ...and only she knew the rules.
translation.ko: 내 인생은 게임이 됐고 규칙은 그녀만이 알았다

translation.en: Ekubo. At the right moment, slip it to Nobu discreetly.
translation.ko: 이 찰떡을 적당한 때에 살짝 노부 씨에게 건네

translation.en: He will know what it means.
translation.ko: 그걸 받으면 무슨 의미인지 알 거야

translation.en: -You have kept us waiting. MAMEHA: Please, forgive us, Nobu-san.
translation.ko: - 왜 이리 늦었어? - 용서하세요, 노부 씨

translation.en: The Chairman thinks I should take more pleasure in life. Music and the theater.
What is your impression?
It is useless to push a cart sideways.
translation.ko: 노부 씨의 발에 맞는 신발이 따로 있는데

translation.en: One could not wish Nobu-san to be anyone but Nobu-san.
translation.ko: 억지로 안 맞는 걸 권할 순 없죠

translation.en: I could not agree more.
I owe this man everything.
NOBU: He gives me too much credit, as usual.
translation.ko: 나한테는 항상 너무 후하게 점수를 준다니까

translation.en: -Probably. Kanpai. ALL: Kanpai.
It is a trinket. I found it a few days ago.
translation.ko: 장신구야 며칠 전에 눈에 띄길래 샀지

translation.en: Nobu-san. I had no idea you were so sentimental.
translation.ko: - 노부 - 왜? 자네가 그렇게 다정한 사람인 줄 몰랐는걸

translation.en: Call it my new leaf.
My mother....
My mother, she used to wear something similar.
You do not like it?
Forgive me. I've never received a present before.
translation.ko: 아니에요, 선물은 평생 처음 받아보는 거라...

translation.en: What a beautiful comb.
Such a joyous moment, Sayuri.
You are finally getting what you deserve.
How lovely.
And now, will you excuse us, please? We have another engagement.
translation.ko: 우린 그만 실례할게요 다른 약속이 있어서

translation.en: Many, in fact.
Pumpkin.
You are most kind.
Now, give this one to Dr. Crab.
translation.ko: - 이걸 크랩 박사한테 줘 - 마메하 언니, 제발

translation.en: -Mameha, please. -You're upset?
translation.ko: - 이걸 크랩 박사한테 줘 - 마메하 언니, 제발 - 화내는 거니? - 저도 큰언니를 믿고 싶어요

translation.en: I want to trust you, I do. But you have to tell me what's going on.
translation.ko: - 화내는 거니? - 저도 큰언니를 믿고 싶어요 도대체 무슨 계획인지 얘기나 해줘요

translation.en: I am ensuring your future. But tell me how. I beg you.
translation.ko: - 널 위한 계획이야 - 어쩌려는 건데요? 제발요

translation.en: I'm trying to orchestrate a bidding war.
-What for? -Your most precious attribute.
-And what is that? -Your mizuage.
Did Mother ever tell you about the eel in the cave?
translation.ko: 너희 엄마가 혹시 동굴의 뱀장어 얘기 해주셨니?

translation.en: Well, every once in a while... ...a man's eel likes to visit a woman's cave.
translation.ko: 가끔 남자의 뱀장어가 여자의 동굴을 찾지

translation.en: -Yes, I know. -You do?
I live with Hatsumomo.
Your cave is untouched. Men like that.
We call this mizuage.
And to become a full geisha, you must sell it to the highest bidder.
translation.ko: 완전한 게이샤가 되려면, 가장 가치가 높은 자에게 팔아야 해

translation.en: Did you sell yours?
The largest sum ever paid. Ten thousand yen.
I freed myself from debt. And so will you.
translation.ko: 빚을 갚고도 남았지 너도 그렇게 될 거야

translation.en: When you slip the rice cake to Dr. Crab...
...it is a sign that says your mizuage is ripe for sale.
The doctor has no desire to see you tonight. Or any night.
translation.ko: 박사님은 당신한테 관심 없으니까 그리 알아요

translation.en: Pumpkin. Hatsumomo went to see Dr. Crab, yes?
I have to go, Chiyo-chan.
-Didn't she? -I do not know.
Of course you know. You shadow her every step.
translation.ko: 당연히 알고 있지 넌 그녀의 그림자잖아

translation.en: You expect me to betray my big sister? Has she made you cruel as well?
translation.ko: - 큰언니를 배신할 순 없어 - 너도 같이 고약해진 거니?

translation.en: -No. -My Pumpkin always told the truth.
But....
The truth.
Tonight we went to the teahouse to see Dr. Crab.
I sat outside, but I could still hear through the screen.
And Hatsumomo then said to him: "I live in the same okiya as Sayuri.
Did you know that she brings men back to her room?"
"No," he said. "Common sailors and fishermen too."
The doctor looked queasy, like he didn't want to hear any more.
translation.ko: 박사가 거북해하면서 듣고 싶어 하지 않았지만

translation.en: But she kept going.
And Hatsumomo said to him, "What's the matter? Have I told you more than you wanted to know?"
translation.ko: 하츠모모가 '왜 그래요? 제가 너무 많은 걸 말했나요?'라고 했어

translation.en: I'm so sorry. I wanted to say something...
translation.ko: 미안해 널 변호하고 싶었지만 내가 무슨 힘이 있어야지

translation.en: ...but how could I, Chiyo-chan? How?
translation.ko: 널 변호하고 싶었지만 내가 무슨 힘이 있어야지 어떻게 그러냐고?

translation.en: Am I really like her? Am I?
Of course not.
Is Mameha-san cruel to you too?
No. She's so kind to me.
But sometimes I worry she's taking me further from the things I want.
translation.ko: 가끔 그녀 속을 알 수 없을 때가 있지만

translation.en: That man Nobu.
Do you really like him?
-No. -That's what I thought.
Do you like somebody else?
Don't worry about me, Chiyo-chan, I'll be fine. Better than fine.
translation.ko: 내 걱정은 마, 난 괜찮을 거야 너무 괜찮아서 탈이지

translation.en: Mother plans to adopt me...
...so my dream of having someplace to live out my life may come true.
translation.ko: 평생 살 집을 갖는 게 소원이었는데 그게 이루어질지도 몰라

translation.en: I have to go.
MAMEHA: We could still win, Sayuri.
How? Hatsumomo has poisoned Dr. Crab against me.
translation.ko: - 아직 승산이 있어 - 어떻게요? 하츠모모가 박사님의 마음을 돌려놨어요

translation.en: Forget about him. There are plenty of other fish in the sea.
-The Chairman has been kind-- -Sayuri.
Nobu and the Chairman are business partners.
They would never bid against one another.
It is time we cast a wider net.
MAMEHA: Suppose there was a night in Miyako...
translation.ko: 어느 날 밤, 미야코에서 수백 명의 남자를

translation.en: ...hundreds of men, all in one place...
-...eager to bid for you. SAYURI: What do you mean?
translation.ko: 한곳에 몰아넣고 경쟁을 붙인다고 생각해봐 무슨 얘기죠?

translation.en: MAMEHA: Where you are the object of all their fantasies.
translation.ko: 모두 네게 환상을 품도록 하는 거야

translation.en: The most famous geisha in the hanamachi.
translation.ko: 하나마치에서 가장 인기 있는 게이샤로 말이야

translation.en: SAYURI: But I'm not. MAMEHA: You will be.
translation.ko: - 하지만 전 아니에요 - 그렇게 될 거야

translation.en: HATSUMOMO: Who is responsible for this?
MOTHER: Ask Mameha.
I'm asking you, Okasan. How come Sayuri gets to be the lead?
It's your own fault. You should practice more.
translation.ko: 네가 한참 처지니까 그렇지 잘 좀 길들여봐

translation.en: What did Mameha do?
Speak to the director in private?
Not every geisha uses that kind of currency.
I'm looking forward to your performance.
You know how I adore watching you dance, Chiyo.
translation.ko: 내가 네 춤 구경하는 거 좋아하는 거 알지, 치요?

translation.en: They've all come. The Baron, Nobu-san...
translation.ko: 다들 왔어, 남작, 노부 씨 친애하는 하츠모모와

translation.en: ...our beloved Hatsumomo and that dapper General of hers.
translation.ko: 다들 왔어, 남작, 노부 씨 친애하는 하츠모모와 그녀의 멋진 장군님까지

translation.en: Anybody else? And even your old friend, Dr. Crab.
translation.ko: - 또 누가 왔죠? - 우리의 박사님도 오셨어

translation.en: Onei-san. What if I dance poorly?
What if I disgrace myself and no one takes interest--? Shh.
translation.ko: 내 얼굴에 먹칠하고 아무도 날 택하지 않으면...

translation.en: You will be glorious.
Now it's time.
Sayuri, you remember the doctor.
I hope my performance pleased you, doctor.
Oh, you dance with such profound feeling.
I most humbly thank you.
It seems you've once again caught the doctor's interest.
translation.ko: 다시 한번 박사님의 관심을 받게 된 거 같구나

translation.en: SAYURI: And I am most grateful.
-If you have heard any gossip... -Ah, yes?
...then I hope you will follow your own advice.
And what would that be, pray tell?
Seek a second opinion.
BARON: Ah, Chairman.
Sayuri gave such a passionate performance, don't you think?
CHAIRMAN: Indeed.
Mameha, did you invite the Chairman to my estate this weekend?
translation.ko: 마메하, 이번 주말에 우리 집에 회장님도 초대했나?

translation.en: It's my annual blossom-viewing party.
translation.ko: - 해마다 여는 벚꽃 파티예요 - 남작님, 전 못 간다고 했는데요

translation.en: Baron, I told you I can't go. I have an urgent appointment.
translation.ko: - 해마다 여는 벚꽃 파티예요 - 남작님, 전 못 간다고 했는데요 급한 일이 있어서요

translation.en: Taking care of a little nuisance? Or was that a naughty secret?
translation.ko: 남몰래 처리할 일이라도 있나요? 아니면 무슨 난잡한 비밀이라도?

translation.en: Baron, wouldn't Sayuri look stunning...
translation.ko: 남작님, 사유리가 가면 댁에 있는 모든 꽃 중에서도

translation.en: ...among the flowers on your estate?
Yes, very pretty. Be sure to send her along.
HATSUMOMO: With a chaperone, of course. I'm certain Mr. Bekku will oblige.
translation.ko: 혼자는 안 보낼 테고 베쿠 씨가 따라가면 되겠네

translation.en: That's a fine idea, Baron. But Sayuri is required at the theater.
translation.ko: 좋은 생각이지만 사유리는 공연을 해야 돼요

translation.en: Mameha, I expect her there.
-Nobu. NOBU: Huh? BARON: Coming Saturday?
All that way to see a cherry tree? I will leave that to the Chairman.
translation.ko: 벚꽃 보러 거기까지 가요? 그런 건 회장님이 좋아하죠

translation.en: Wonderful tonight. Excuse me.
If you would rather not go....
I'd like to go very much.
Then be on your guard, every moment.
MAMEHA: There is a reason Hatsumomo wants you there.
Trust me, I know my Baron, Sayuri.
He has a weakness for beautiful women.
And now you are the most celebrated geisha in all Miyako.
translation.ko: 오늘 넌 미야코 최고의 스타가 됐어

translation.en: The most desired as well.
CHAIRMAN: Pardon. Pardon me. Pardon me. Sayuri.
translation.ko: 실례합니다 사유리, 오늘은 벚꽃마저도 사유리를 시샘하는군요

translation.en: Today, even the cherry blossoms are envious of her.
CHAIRMAN: There's something I've been wanting to say to you... ...for some time now.
I'd like to....
To thank you for your attention to Nobu-san.
Nobu can be a difficult man. So severe.
translation.ko: 노부는 꽤 까다로운 친구지 좀 심하지, 파티도 싫어하고 술도 별로 즐기지 않고

translation.en: Hates parties, sake only in moderation.
translation.ko: 좀 심하지, 파티도 싫어하고 술도 별로 즐기지 않고

translation.en: And he disdains geisha.
But he....
He's fond of you.
Because you admire him, I respect him more.
He will never tell you himself. He's far too modest.
translation.ko: 매우 절제하는 편이라 자기 얘기는 안 했을 거야

translation.en: We were fighting in Manchuria together. There was an explosion.
translation.ko: 우린 함께 전쟁에 나갔었는데 폭발 사고가 있었지

translation.en: He protected me from the worst of it.
As you might imagine, I owe him quite a debt.
translation.ko: 이제 알겠지만 난 그에게 많은 걸 빚졌어

translation.en: Nobu has taught me a great deal. Patience, for one thing.
translation.ko: 노부는 나에게 많은 걸 알려줬어 인내심도 그중 하나지

translation.en: I, in turn, have tried to teach him...
translation.ko: 그 보답으로 그 친구에게 가르쳐주고 싶어

translation.en: ...you have to savor life while you can.
The lesson of the cherry blossom.
That is why Nobu likes you.
We must not expect happiness, Sayuri. It is not something we deserve.
translation.ko: 행복은 바란다고 오지 않아 당연한 것도 아니고

translation.en: When life goes well, it's a sudden gift.
translation.ko: 삶이 잘 풀리는 건 삶이 주는 예기치 않은 선물이지

translation.en: It cannot last forever.
BARON: Ah, Sayuri.
There you are. I have a present for you.
translation.ko: 여기 있었군 선물로 줄 게 있어

translation.en: Mameha asked me to show you my kimono collection.
It's quite venerated.
My grandfather and father collected kimono before me.
I've given a number of valuable kimono to Mameha.
translation.ko: 마메하에게도 값비싼 거로 여러 벌 선물했지

translation.en: I like to give present to beautiful girls.
It's for you.
Come. Have a closer look.
Isn't it lovely?
Try it on.
The Baron is too kind.
I will happily try it on with Mameha when the Baron returns to Miyako.
translation.ko: 남작님이 미야코로 돌아오시면 언니와 기쁜 마음으로 입어볼게요

translation.en: Who knows when that will be? Put it on now. Don't be shy.
translation.ko: 언제가 될 줄 알고 지금 입어봐, 부끄러워 말고

translation.en: Don't worry.
I am experienced in knotting obis. And untying them as well.
translation.ko: 나도 오비를 맬 줄 알아 푸는 건 더 잘하지

translation.en: Please. Mr. Bekku is waiting. Bekku is waiting for no one.
translation.ko: - 밖에서 베쿠 씨가 기다려요 - 베쿠는 기다리지 않아

translation.en: SAYURI: Please!
Stop!
Please! Stop now!
Sayuri.... I only want to have a look.
translation.ko: 사유리 한 번 보기만 할 거야

translation.en: No harm in that.
Any man would do the same.
MAMEHA: I heard a message on the wind. So careless.
-You have ruined all our plans. -I did nothing.
Please, Sayuri, do not insult me. I know the Baron better than that.
translation.ko: - 난 순결해요 - 감히 누굴 속여! - 난 남작을 잘 알아 - 기모노를 줬어요

translation.en: He gave me a kimono.
translation.ko: - 난 남작을 잘 알아 - 기모노를 줬어요

translation.en: -You sold yourself for a kimono. -I did not sell myself!
translation.ko: 그것 때문에 널 팔았니? 나를 판 적 없어요!

translation.en: Today is the day I accept bids for your mizuage.
What kind of price can I hope to demand... ...with a finger pointed at your back?
translation.ko: 이미 더럽혀진 네게 누가 입찰을 하겠니?

translation.en: He looked at me, that's all, Onei-san.
translation.ko: 그는 날 보기만 했어요 그게 전부예요, 큰언니

translation.en: You will be examined at the mizuage ceremony.
If you are found to be worthless.... I am not worthless!
translation.ko: - 네가 가치 없다고 밝혀지면... - 그렇지 않아요!

translation.en: I am not worthless.
HATSUMOMO: How much longer is this bidding going to take?
translation.ko: 얼마나 더 기다려야 입찰이 끝나는 건가요?

translation.en: Besides, who wants a plum when someone has already had a bite?
translation.ko: 게다가 남이 베어 먹은 자두를 누가 원하겠어요?

translation.en: What is it?
Twenty yen? Thirty?
This can't be the right amount.
I trust you agree. I have won the wager.
Sayuri's made history.
No mizuage has ever been sold for more. Not even mine.
translation.ko: 최고 기록이죠 유례없는 '미즈아게'의 가격이에요 저보다 훨씬 높죠

translation.en: Fifteen thousand yen.
Unbelievable.
Of course, none of it will go to Sayuri.
translation.ko: 고마워요, 큰언니 이 돈은 사유리 게 아니야 당신 것도 아니고요

translation.en: Or to you, Mameha. It goes to this okiya.
translation.ko: 이 돈은 사유리 게 아니야 당신 것도 아니고요 '오키야' 거야

translation.en: All 15,000 yen to this estate.
I do not understand.
That Sayuri will inherit as my adopted daughter.
translation.ko: 물론 나중엔 수양딸로서 사유리한테 물려줄 거야

translation.en: -What? HATSUMOMO: You wouldn't dare.
I'm entitled to do as I choose.
But you promised the okiya to Pumpkin!
Look at her. Still a virgin maiko.
-Pumpkin! -Can't you adopt us both?
translation.ko: - 펌킨! - 둘 다 택하면 안 되나요?

translation.en: Quiet, Sayuri. I'm no fool.
Pumpkin would only be Hatsumomo's puppet.
How long will it take before you kick us out onto the street?
HATSUMOMO: I have given you my life.
Yes. Your impudence. Your foul temper.
translation.ko: 그랬지, 그 몰염치하고 더러운 성질을 다 받아줬지

translation.en: Who paid for the silk on your back? The rice in your bowl?
translation.ko: 누구 덕에 그 비단옷을 입고 있는데? 밥값에다

translation.en: The tobacco in that pipe of yours? Who?
Don't exaggerate! You have never even had a danna.
translation.ko: 오버하지 마! 후견인도 못 얻은 주제에

translation.en: Don't say it. Don't say-- MOTHER: You chose that no-good Koichi.
Stop it.
Sneaking through your window at all hours of the night.
translation.ko: - 그만해! - 밤마다 빠져나가 - 몸을 굴린 게 누군데 - 조용히 해!

translation.en: HATSUMOMO: Quiet!
translation.ko: - 몸을 굴린 게 누군데 - 조용히 해!

translation.en: Not like a geisha. Like a common prostitute.
translation.ko: 넌 게이샤가 아니라 천한 창녀 같아

translation.en: MOTHER: Besides, you are getting old.
But Sayuri?
Sayuri is destined to become a legend. Huh?
My dear Okasan.
We will see...
...won't we?
Sayuri, your room is too small. Take Hatsumomo's.
translation.ko: 사유리, 네겐 큰 방이 필요해 하츠모모랑 바꿔

translation.en: From now on, your name is Nitta Sayuri.
May I congratulate you both. You too.
translation.ko: - 모녀가 된 걸 축하드려요 - 당신도 축하해요

translation.en: SAYURI: Onei-san.
Everything we wanted, you made happen. Thank you.
translation.ko: 이 모든 게 큰언니 덕분이에요 고마워요

translation.en: May I ask who? Dr. Crab.
Was Nobu disappointed?
translation.ko: - 노부 씨가 실망했을까요? - 그는 참가 안 했어

translation.en: Nobu did not bid. It was against his mighty principles.
translation.ko: - 노부 씨가 실망했을까요? - 그는 참가 안 했어 이런 의식은 그의 신조와 안 맞거든

translation.en: Dr. Crab was opposed by the Baron. My Baron.
Do you want to know the truth, Sayuri?
He was the highest bidder.
Forgive me. But I let it go to Dr. Crab.
I think you understand why.
I swear to you, I am innocent. Of course you are.
No man would ever bid so much for a thing he had already taken.
translation.ko: 이미 널 취했다면 그렇게 큰돈을 걸 리가 없지

translation.en: It was my own fault. I did not protect you.
Celebrate this moment, Sayuri.
Tonight, the lights in the hanamachi all burn for you.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 하나마치의 주인공은 바로 너야

translation.en: MOTHER: My daughter.
You are full geisha now.
SAYURI: What are you doing in my room?
I came to congratulate you.
Please get out.
Why, little Chiyo. Look what I found.
His initials, how elegant.
You've been hiding your love for a long time.
The sacrifice every geisha must make. Don't!
translation.ko: - 이런 게 게이샤의 비애지 - 안 돼!

translation.en: Isn't this where you keep it? Next to your heart?
Give it back!
Give it back!
No!
Mother!
Pumpkin! Mother!
MOTHER: Kimono!
Kimono! Pumpkin!
SAYURI: I could be her.
Now I am geisha to this house.
I could be her.
Were we so different?
She loved once. She hoped once.
I might be looking into my own future.
Until the real future came falling from the air.
translation.ko: 그리고 얼마 후 진짜 미래가 찾아왔다

translation.en: CHAIRMAN: Stop.
Oh, Korin. Have you seen Sayuri? No. I don't know.
translation.ko: - 코린, 사유리 못 봤나? - 전 몰라요

translation.en: MAMEHA: Chairman!
They are sending us away, but they won't say where.
Osaka. But you must not go. The city is a prime target.
translation.ko: 오사카인데, 가면 안 돼 거기야말로 더 위험해

translation.en: Get your things, quickly.
Nobu and I are trying to find safe havens... ...for as many of you as we can. Come.
translation.ko: 노부랑 내가 사람들을 보낼 만한 안전한 곳을 찾고 있어, 이리 와

translation.en: Here.
Work certificate. Nurse's aide.
Friend of mine is chief surgeon in Kameoka.
translation.ko: 가메오카시에 있는 내 친구를 찾아가, 외과 과장이야

translation.en: What about Sayuri? Can't we go together?
Don't worry. She will be taken care of.
translation.ko: 걱정 마 우리가 잘 돌봐줄 거야

translation.en: Here you are. Here we go!
-Sayuri. -Onei-san.
Sayuri! Come.
This is Arima. He will take you into the hills.
translation.ko: 이 사람은 아리마인데 산 쪽으로 데려다줄 거야

translation.en: Nobu has got a friend there. A kimono-maker.
translation.ko: 거기에 노부의 친구가 있는데 기모노를 만드는 장인이지

translation.en: Anyone stops you, show them this.
-Do I have to go? -It's remote. You will be safe.
translation.ko: - 꼭 가야 해요? - 멀리 떨어진 곳이라 안전할 거야

translation.en: What about you? You said Osaka was dangerous.
Our factory is there. I have no choice.
translation.ko: 공장 때문에 안 가볼 수가 없어

translation.en: Go!
I will express your gratitude to Nobu-san.
SAYURI: A year without news...
...except news of death, defeat, shame.
translation.ko: 1년 동안 들리는 건 죽음, 패배, 치욕의 뉴스와

translation.en: Rumors of cities evaporating into clouds of smoke.
Then another year...
...and then another...
...until the old life is a dream life.
Was I ever geisha?
Did I ever dance... ...holding a fan?
Who would hold a fan now...
...or paint their lips?
And then another year.
Nothing.
Rice. Work.
Rice. Work.
Nothing.
MAN: Sayuri!
Sayuri! A man from Osaka has come to see you.
Nobu-san.
General Tottori was captured and tried as a war criminal.
The Baron lost his fortune and committed suicide.
What about the okiya?
Mr. Bekku is gone, but the others-- Auntie and Mother?
translation.ko: - 베쿠 씨는 죽었고, 나머지는... - 아줌마와 대모는요?

translation.en: NOBU: Indestructible, as always.
And the Chairman?
As well as can be expected.
This is all that remains of our factories.
I'm so sorry, Nobu-san.
Sayuri....
We want to rebuild, but to do that we will need your help.
translation.ko: 우리가 다시 일어나려면 당신 도움이 필요해

translation.en: What can I do? Somewhere, under those rags...
translation.ko: - 제가 뭘 어떻게요? - 이렇게 누더길 걸쳤지만

translation.en: ...are you still the greatest geisha in Miyako?
If a tree has no leaves or branches, can you still call it a tree?
translation.ko: 다 말라버린 나무를 나무라 할 수 있나요?

translation.en: With nothing but rubble at my feet, can I still call myself a businessman?
translation.ko: 그럼 돌멩이밖에 안 남은 나를 사업가라 부를 수 있을까?

translation.en: I should have taken better care of you. Please, you saved my life.
translation.ko: - 좀 더 잘 돌봐줬어야 했는데 - 아니에요, 절 구해주셨는걸요

translation.en: I owe you so much in return.
The Chairman and I need American financing.
There is a man, a certain Colonel Derricks...
...who has the power to grant us a contract.
I showed him your picture.
He asked to meet you.
I am not a persuasive man, Sayuri. But if you and a few geisha...
translation.ko: 강요하는 건 아니지만 당신과 게이샤 몇 명이

translation.en: ...would once again put on your kimono and join us...
...we could show the Americans how hospitable our country can be.
translation.ko: 저들의 호감을 살 수 있을 것 같아

translation.en: How I wish, Nobu-san.
But that was a long time ago. I have no doubt, Sayuri...
translation.ko: - 안 해본 지 오래돼서요 - 당신은 지금도

translation.en: ...that you could still melt the heart of any man.
No matter how resistant.
I am not accustomed to begging...
...but please know that if you consent...
...the Chairman and I would be most grateful.
translation.ko: 회장도 나도 정말 고맙게 생각할 거야

translation.en: VENDOR: One dollar. One dollar. SOLDIER: What? VENDOR: One dollar.
SAYURI: The Chairman needed me.
But I was a far cry from the geisha I had once been.
The secrets of our hidden world were postcards now for girls back home.
translation.ko: 베일에 싸였던 게이샤의 세계는 이제 고향에 있는 소녀들을 위한 그림엽서처럼 변했다

translation.en: Any streetwalker with a painted face and silk kimono...
translation.ko: 거리의 창녀들까지 분을 바르고 비단 기모노를 입고는

translation.en: ...could call herself a geisha.
I looked for the one person who might help:
Mameha.
The war was written on her face.
Everything about her, not just her home, was less than before.
translation.ko: 집뿐만 아니라 모든 게 이전보다 더 형편없고 초라했다

translation.en: Sayuri, when my poor Baron filled his pockets with stones...
translation.ko: 사유리, 가엾은 남작님이 주머니를 돌멩이로 가득 채운 걸 봤을 때, 앞이 캄캄했어

translation.en: ...I was desperate.
translation.ko: 주머니를 돌멩이로 가득 채운 걸 봤을 때, 앞이 캄캄했어

translation.en: What could I do? I sold my kimono, I traded my jade combs for rations.
translation.ko: 어쩌겠니? 기모노와 옥으로 된 장식 빗을 다 팔아버렸지

translation.en: It was painful at first, but I have made my peace.
Now, I make a small but tidy living renting rooms.
translation.ko: 집세를 낼 만큼 돈도 벌고 있고

translation.en: I am not about to go chasing the past.
It might do you good.
-How? -To remind you that, once...
translation.ko: 어떻게? 예전처럼 단 한 번의 눈길로

translation.en: ...with a single glance, you could bring a man like the Baron to his knees.
translation.ko: 예전처럼 단 한 번의 눈길로 남작 같은 분을 사로잡을 수 있어요

translation.en: Well....
I did keep one kimono.
The Baron gave it to me when he became my danna.
translation.ko: 남작이 내 후견인이 되었을 때 받았던 첫 선물이야

translation.en: Thank you, Onei-san.
So tell me. What do we know about entertaining Americans?
Chiyo-chan! Is that you?
SAYURI: I have no right to ask favors of you, Pumpkin, I know that.
translation.ko: 네게 부탁할 자격 없는 거 알아, 펌킨

translation.en: Guess what. I only smoke Chesterfields now.
translation.ko: 난 요즘 양담배만 피우는 거 아니?

translation.en: I have wanted to apologize to you for so long about the okiya.
These soldiers, you know who they've got me singing?
translation.ko: 이 군인들이 누구 노래를 부르라고 한 줄 알아?

translation.en: -It should have gone to you. -Frank Sinatra and Dinah Shore.
translation.ko: 네가 물려받았어야 했는데... 프랭크 시나트라와 다이나 쇼어 알아?

translation.en: If it is in your heart to forgive me.... Sayuri, don't.
The honest truth?
I'd rather chew sand than go back to all that.
translation.ko: 그때로 돌아가느니 모래를 씹어 먹는 게 나아

translation.en: Then you are not angry with me?
Don't worry about me, chickadee. I've got more clients than I can handle.
translation.ko: 내 걱정은 마 난 지금 고객이 넘쳐

translation.en: You seem so at home with these Americans.
They're bastards.
So who's this colonel? Sounds like top brass.
He has the power to approve American funding...
translation.ko: 노부 씨와 회장님의 사업에 - 돈을 대줄 수 있는 - 사케 줘요

translation.en: -Sake. -...for Nobu and the Chairman.
translation.ko: - 돈을 대줄 수 있는 - 사케 줘요 그런 자리에 있나 봐

translation.en: So is he willing to pay us American dollars?
Cash?
MOTHER: Don't waste my time. You think I'm a sucker?
I want 60 cases Lucky Strike...
...or I'm taking my business to Sergeant MacPhee.
SAYURI: I had to become a geisha once more.
translation.ko: 난 한 번 더 게이샤가 되기로 했다

translation.en: Mother had reopened the okiya, but my powder box was empty.
translation.ko: 대모가 '오키야'를 다시 열었지만 남아있는 거라곤 빈 분첩과

translation.en: My charcoal had turned to dust.
And yet, it was my one chance to see the Chairman again.
Would he notice my weathered hands?
translation.ko: 내 거친 손과 실밥이 터진 옷을

translation.en: The threadbare silk?
See? You are yourself again.
The world had changed completely. Had he?
And would I finally find the strength to tell him all that I felt?
translation.ko: 이번엔 내 마음을 고백할 수 있을까?

translation.en: Just look at you, Sayuri. It's as if the war did not happen.
translation.ko: 정말 놀랍군, 사유리 전쟁이 언제 일어났었나 싶군

translation.en: I am so glad to see that the Chairman is safe.
Accept my apologies asking this of you--
No.
There is nothing I can do to return your kindness.
-I've wanted to tell you that-- NOBU: Sayuri!
May I present Colonel Derricks.
-Konnichi-wa. -Konnichi-wa.
My God, you're more stunning in person.
This is my associate, Lieutenant Hutchins.
-It's an honor, ma'am. -Konnichi-wa.
Sayuri is one of the mysteries of the Orient I told you about.
translation.ko: 사유리는 내가 전에 말했던 동양의 불가사의 중 하나지

translation.en: A mystery that perhaps you can solve.
-Would you mind? Can we...? Colonel. -Yes, of course. Colonel.
translation.ko: - 괜찮다면 한 장 어때요? 대령님? - 네, 물론이죠

translation.en: Okay, sure.
HUTCHINS: All right, hold it. Beautiful.
Hey, who likes whiskey? Woo-hoo! Look at this. We got a live one, sir.
translation.ko: - 저기요, 위스키 마실 분? - 보세요, 재밌는 분이 오셨네요

translation.en: Chairman, please don't tell me you started the party without me.
translation.ko: 회장님, 저 빼고 파티를 시작한 건 아니죠?

translation.en: May I present Pumpkin.
PUMPKIN: Hello! HUTCHINS: Pumpkin! Over here.
translation.ko: - 안녕하세요 - 펌킨 - 펌킨, 이쪽 봐요 - 반가워요

translation.en: One sec.
Okay! Gentlemen! Please.
translation.ko: 좋아요 - 여러분, 타시죠 - 이게 얼마 만인가요?

translation.en: PUMPKIN: Oh, it's been a long time. CHAIRMAN: Good to see you.
translation.ko: - 여러분, 타시죠 - 이게 얼마 만인가요? - 반가워요 - 그대로시네요

translation.en: You haven't changed. You look like a little boy.
translation.ko: - 반가워요 - 그대로시네요 더 젊어지신 거 같아요!

translation.en: This is a-- My!
DERRICKS: Please, have a seat. Buckle up.
DERRICKS: Good for him, not so good for us.
PUMPKIN: May we join you, gentlemen? DERRICKS: Yes, please.
HUTCHINS: Wow, I could get used to this.
Back home, a bath is nothing more than a quick shower on cold tile... ...with a bar of lye soap, right?
translation.ko: 집에 돌아가면 그냥 비누로 샤워만 뚝딱 할 텐데, 안 그래요?

translation.en: But here, you make everything a ritual, don't you?
That is the art of turning habit into pleasure, colonel.
Spoken like a true geisha.
If we are in business together, then perhaps we will visit you someday.
I'd like to see the United States.
I know a little game we can play. It's called Truth and Lies.
translation.ko: 우리 재미있는 게임을 해요 '진실과 거짓' 게임

translation.en: I know this game. Back home we call it "marriage."
translation.ko: 그 게임 알아요, 미국에선 그걸 '결혼'이라고 하지

translation.en: No, I'm serious. Now, listen closely.
translation.ko: 농담 마시고요 잘 들으세요 규칙은 사유리가 잘 알죠

translation.en: Sayuri know the rules.
translation.ko: 잘 들으세요 규칙은 사유리가 잘 알죠

translation.en: HUTCHINS: I never met a woman who didn't.
Each person says two things. One is true, the other is not.
translation.ko: 각자 두 가지를 말하는데 하나는 진실, 하나는 거짓이에요

translation.en: If you guess right, the liar pays the price.
translation.ko: 거짓말을 들킨 사람이 벌주를 마셔야 해요

translation.en: So it pays to lose. PUMPKIN: There you go.
Okay, I'll go first. Let's see.
One day in Sapporo, where I was born...
...a fisherman caught a talking fish.
CHAIRMAN: The other story is the true one. And I haven't even heard it yet.
PUMPKIN: How would you know? -No, no. You drink. You drink.
If I drown, it's all your fault.
CHAIRMAN: Nobu-san, your turn. Please.
translation.ko: - 익사하면 책임져요 - 당신 차례요 난 패스, 상대가 안 되거든요 거짓말은 게이샤가 전문이죠

translation.en: I'm no match for these geisha. They are experts in the art of deceit.
translation.ko: 난 패스, 상대가 안 되거든요 거짓말은 게이샤가 전문이죠

translation.en: I'm an expert in one thing and one thing only: Sake.
translation.ko: 제 전문 분야는 딱 하나예요 바로 사케!

translation.en: Sayuri, the truest story you know.
Once, when I was a little girl... ...on the banks of the Sunagawa...
...a handsome stranger was kind enough... ...to buy me a cup of sweet ice--
CHAIRMAN: I think we have to stop the game.
If Pumpkin drinks any more sake, she will pass out.
Oh, that is a true story. CHAIRMAN: Mameha. Sayuri. Everyone.
PUMPKIN: I'm sorry. HUTCHINS: Okay.
So...
...what is the protocol?
Excuse me?
Suppose I wanted to see you in private.
I beg your pardon, colonel, that is not a geisha's custom.
translation.ko: 죄송하지만, 게이샤는 그런 시중을 들지 않아요

translation.en: Don't be coy. I mean, if it's a question of price, I'm sure--
If there were a price, you could never afford it.
I saw the two of you whispering.
You have arranged some kind of tryst, haven't you?
-What did you promise him? -Your company. Nothing more.
translation.ko: 그에게 뭘 약속했죠? 여기 함께 오는 거

translation.en: He seemed to expect a great deal!
If I had wanted a common whore, I could have hired one.
What are you trying to say?
Just the idea of you with him, with any man...
translation.ko: 당신이 딴 놈과 있는 상상만 해도!

translation.en: ...you'd be dead to me!
Can't you see that I want you for myself?
You have ruined me.
Before we met, I was a disciplined man.
I should not have asked you to come.
The Chairman was against it. I should have listened to him.
I must beg your forgiveness, Nobu-san.
I was foolish to think you would barter me away.
Then you made no arrangement with the colonel?
translation.ko: 그럼 대령과의 밀회 약속은 없는 거지

translation.en: Please don't insult me again.
If he ratifies our contract...
...then I will be a man of means again.
There is nothing I want more, Sayuri...
...than to become your danna.
I already owe you far too much. -I will not be refused. -Please.
translation.ko: - 이미 신세 진 게 너무 많아요 - 거절하지 마

translation.en: We are tied to each other. I know you feel it too.
translation.ko: - 그만하세요 - 우린 서로 인연이 깊어 - 너도 날 좋아하잖아 - 오해하시게 한 적 없는데요

translation.en: I never meant to mislead you.
translation.ko: - 너도 날 좋아하잖아 - 오해하시게 한 적 없는데요

translation.en: Sayuri....
I do not like things held up before me...
translation.ko: 난 내가 가질 수 없는 것들을

translation.en: ...that I cannot have.
translation.ko: 내 눈앞에서 빼앗기는 걸 보고 싶지 않아

translation.en: SAYURI: When you first introduced me to Nobu... ...I was such a fool to give him my attention.
translation.ko: 처음 만났을 때부터 관심 있는 척하는 게 아니었어요

translation.en: -You cannot refuse him. You must not. -But, Mameha--
translation.ko: - 넌 거절할 수 없어, 그럼 안 돼 - 하지만 마메하 언니...

translation.en: What is he to think? He safeguarded your life.
translation.ko: 노부 씨 생각이 뭔데? 널 평생 돌봐주겠다잖아

translation.en: -So he owns it? -Sayuri.
I know what it is like to try and scrape by without a danna.
I will do something, anything else.
Renting rooms? Scrounging for every meal?
Is this the life that you want?
I want a life that is mine!
Nobu has never treated you with anything but kindness.
-I don't want mere kindness. -What?
What more can we expect, we geisha?
translation.ko: 게이샤가 그 이상 뭘 더 바라니?

translation.en: You had feelings for the Baron, didn't you?
I never allowed myself that.
Don't lie to me.
In time, you learn.
-I don't want to learn! -Sayuri!
We don't become geisha to pursue our own destinies.
We become geisha because we have no choice.
translation.ko: 선택할 수 없어서 게이샤가 된 거야

translation.en: SAYURI: Pumpkin. What is it? What's wrong?
Nothing. I have a favor to ask, that's all.
Ask.
At 9:00, bring Nobu to the pool on the far side of the garden.
translation.ko: 9시에 노부 씨를 정원 건너편에 있는 스파로 데려와 줘

translation.en: Not a minute before, not a minute after. Yes?
And, please, do not tell Nobu that I will be there waiting.
translation.ko: 노부 씨한테 내가 기다린다는 말은 하지 말고

translation.en: It's a surprise?
Yes, it's a surprise.
Whoa, in here?
What--? No, no, no. Hang on. Hey, hey, hey. No, whoa.
Wait! DERRICKS: Are we doing this or not?
Yes?
Chairman.
Chairman!
How could you?
You don't know what you have done!
But I do.
I do not understand.
Why did you have to bring the Chairman?
Because I know how you feel about him.
A long time ago, you took something from me.
translation.ko: 예전에 너도 내가 그토록 원했던 것을 내게서 빼앗아갔지

translation.en: The only thing I'd ever truly wanted.
translation.ko: 내가 진심으로 원했던 단 한 가지를

translation.en: Well...
...now you know how it feels.
SAYURI: The heart dies a slow death.
Shedding each hope like leaves.
Until one day there are none.
No hopes.
Nothing remains.
She paints her face to hide her face.
Her eyes are deep water.
It is not for geisha to want.
It is not for geisha to feel.
Geisha is an artist of the floating world.
She dances.
She sings.
She entertains you.
Whatever you want.
The rest is shadows.
The rest is secret.
MOTHER: Sayuri, quickly. The teahouse just called.
You are to meet a very important client tonight.
Who?
It must be Nobu. Yes.
He is going to be one of the richest men in Osaka.
translation.ko: 지금 오사카에서 최고의 부자가 될 거야

translation.en: He wants to honor his promise: To become your danna at last.
translation.ko: 약속을 지키려는 거야 후견인이 되겠단 약속 말이다

translation.en: Give me.
It's about time.
Finally, a return on my investment.
Keiko, maybe one day you will be as lucky.
translation.ko: 키코, 너도 운 좋으면 후견인이 생길 거야

translation.en: No geisha can ever hope for more.
Let me see it.
Chairman.
Where is Nobu-san? He won't be coming.
Is something wrong?
translation.ko: - 무슨 일이 생겼나요? - 무슨 일이 있었는지 알고 있어

translation.en: He knows what happened. It is not in his nature to forgive.
translation.ko: - 무슨 일이 생겼나요? - 무슨 일이 있었는지 알고 있어 대령과의 일 때문에 널 용서할 수 없나 봐

translation.en: Chairman, what happened on the island--
translation.ko: 회장님 - 그 날 있었던 일은... - 설명 안 해도 돼

translation.en: Please, you do not have to explain.
translation.ko: - 그 날 있었던 일은... - 설명 안 해도 돼

translation.en: But I have shamed myself so deeply, past all forgiveness.
translation.ko: 용서받지 않으면 평생 괴로울 것 같아요

translation.en: No. I'm the one who must be forgiven.
translation.ko: 아니, 용서를 빌 사람은 바로 나야

translation.en: I do not understand.
Perhaps...
...if you had only known the truth....
The truth?
Some years ago...
...I was on my way to the theater.
I saw a little girl weeping by the Sunagawa.
translation.ko: 스나가와강 근처에서 울고 있는 아이를 봤지

translation.en: I stopped to buy her a cup of sweet ice.
translation.ko: 난 그 아이를 달래려고 빙수를 사줬어

translation.en: You knew I was that little girl?
translation.ko: 그 애가 저인 걸 알고 계셨어요?

translation.en: Didn't you ever wonder why Mameha took you under her wing?
translation.ko: 왜 마메하가 널 거뒀는지 궁금한 적 없었어?

translation.en: Mameha came to me because of you.
I wish you could have told me long ago.
What could I do?
I owe Nobu my life.
And so...
...when I saw he had a chance at happiness with you, I stood silent.
translation.ko: 너로 인해 노부가 기뻐하는 모습을 보니, 입이 안 떨어졌지

translation.en: But....
But I cannot any longer.
I hope...
...it is not too late.
Don't be afraid to look at me, Chiyo.
Can't you see?
Every step I have taken...
...since I was that child on the bridge...
...has been to bring myself closer to you.
SAYURI: You cannot say to the sun, "More sun."
translation.ko: 이미 밝은 태양에게 어찌 더 많은 빛을 구하리오

translation.en: Or to the rain, "Less rain."
translation.ko: 비에게는 어찌 조금 덜 내려달라 하리오

translation.en: To a man, geisha can only be half a wife.
translation.ko: 남자에게 있어 게이샤는 온전한 아내가 될 수 없다

translation.en: We are the wives of nightfall.
And yet, to learn of kindness... ...after so much unkindness...
translation.ko: 하지만 세상의 무심함 뒤에 따스함이 있다는 걸 알게 되고

translation.en: ...to understand that a little girl with more courage than she knew...
translation.ko: 자신이 지닌 것보다 더 큰 용기를 얻은 한 어린 소녀가

translation.en: ...would find her prayers were answered...
translation.ko: 결국 자신의 간절한 소망을 이루었다는 걸 생각해보면

translation.en: ...can that not be called happiness?
After all...
...these are not the memoirs of an empress, nor of a queen.
translation.ko: 어느 황녀의 추억도 어느 여왕의 추억도 아니요

translation.en: These are memoirs of another kind.
